intro: Rhamnus baldschuanica, commonly known as the Caucasian buckthorn, is a deciduous shrub native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters and features small, elliptical leaves that are dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers in clusters during the spring, followed by small, black berries in the fall. It is often found in rocky or mountainous areas and is adapted to dry, sunny conditions. The species is valued for its ornamental qualities and has some traditional medicinal uses.
